title: > transforms.RandomCrop(size=32, padding=(0,1,2,3)),
body_html:
This is incorrect usage, this is not expected to work.
Refer to https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/torchvision/transforms.html#torchvision.transforms.RandomCrop for correct usage, maybe you want padding=(1,1,1,1) or something like that

Originally posted by @soumith in #13704 (comment)

Thanks for check my issue.
Already, I used padding=[1,2,3,4] also.
But this error hanppend,
TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'list' and 'int'
What do you think about this?

body:
This is incorrect usage, this is not expected to work.
Refer to https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/torchvision/transforms.html#torchvision.transforms.RandomCrop for correct usage, maybe you want `padding=(1,1,1,1)` or something like that

_Originally posted by @soumith in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/13704#issuecomment-436861971_

Thanks for check my issue.
Already, I used padding=[1,2,3,4] also.
But this error hanppend,
TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'list' and 'int'
What do you think about this?
